input_text:
Job Title: Sr Business Analyst IT Digital Workplace

Location: Sunnyvale, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

Primary Function of Position

We are looking for a Sr. Business Analyst, IT Digital Workplace to join our IT team and help us deliver innovative solutions for our employees and customers. You will be accountable for examining, designing, and implementing workplace-collaboration and productivity applications like Zoom, Box, Microsoft O365, Slack, and more. You will also work closely with business stakeholders, IT project managers, and developers to ensure alignment of business requirements and IT solutions.

Essential Job Duties

Review business needs and processes, and elicit, document, and validate business requirements for workplace-collaboration and productivity applications.Translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications, and create user stories, use cases, and acceptance criteria.Conduct feasibility studies, gap review, and impact assessment of proposed solutions, and recommend the best fit for the business and IT.Partner with IT project managers, developers, testers, and vendors to deliver solutions that meet business goals, quality standards, and timelines.Provide end-to-end help for the implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance of workplace-collaboration and productivity applications.Facilitate user training, communication, and change management activities to ensure smooth adoption and usage of workplace-collaboration and productivity applications.Monitor and measure the performance, usage, and benefits of workplace-collaboration and productivity applications, and provide feedback and suggestions for improvement.Stay updated on the latest trends, best practices, and technologies in the workplace-collaboration and productivity domain, and disseminate knowledge and insights with the IT team and the business.

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience

10+ years of experience as a business analyst, IT analyst, or similar role in the workplace-collaboration and productivity domain.Proven knowledge and experience with workplace-collaboration and productivity applications like Zoom, Box, Microsoft O365, Slack, Unily, Lucid, and more.Excellent communication, presentation, and relational skills, and the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders.Excellent deductive, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, and the ability to translate business needs into IT solutions.Proficient in business data tools and techniques, such as requirements elicitation, documentation, validation, traceability, and management.Experience with agile methodologies, such as Scrum, KanbanExperience working in GxP environment.Must be willing/able to work onsite in Sunnyvale, CA office.

Required Education And Training

Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

Preferred Skills And Experience

Knowledge of data analysis, modeling, and visualization tools, such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.Familiarity with project management tools and best practices, such as Jira, Confluence, or MS Project.Certification in business data, workplace-collaboration, or productivity applications is a plus.Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and domains quickly and autonomously.

Additional Information

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

We provide market-competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay, incentives, benefits, and equity. It would not be typical for someone to be hired at the top end of range for the role, as actual pay will be determined based on several factors, including experience, skills, and qualifications. The target salary ranges are listed.

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Preference will be given to qualified candidates who do not reside, or plan to reside, in Alabama, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Indiana, Iowa, Louisiana, Maryland, Mississippi, Missouri, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, or Tennessee.

We provide market-competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay, incentives, benefits, and equity. It would not be typical for someone to be hired at the top end of range for the role, as actual pay will be determined based on several factors, including experience, skills, and qualifications. The target salary ranges are listed.

Base Salary Range Region 1:$145,100 - $208,900

Base Salary Range Region 2: $123,400 - $177,600

Shift: Day

Travel: 10% of the time

Workplace Type: Set Schedule - This job will be onsite weekly, the percentage of onsite work will be defined by the leader.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
